Uses of Class
android.app.Activity

Packages that use Activity
android.app High-level classes encapsulating the overall Android application model. 
android.media Provides classes that manage various media interfaces in audio and video. 
android.preference Provides classes that manage application preferences and implement the preferences UI. 
android.test A framework for writing Android test cases and suites. 
 

Uses of Activity in android.app
 

Subclasses of Activity in android.app
 class ActivityGroup
          A screen that contains and runs multiple embedded activities.
 class AliasActivity
          Stub activity that launches another activity (and then finishes itself) based on information in its component's manifest meta-data.
 class ExpandableListActivity
          An activity that displays an expandable list of items by binding to a data source implementing the ExpandableListAdapter, and exposes event handlers when the user selects an item.
 class LauncherActivity
          Displays a list of all activities which can be performed for a given intent.
 class ListActivity
          An activity that displays a list of items by binding to a data source such as an array or Cursor, and exposes event handlers when the user selects an item.
 class TabActivity
          An activity that contains and runs multiple embedded activities or views.

Uses of Activity in android.test
 

Classes in android.test with type parameters of type Activity
 class ActivityInstrumentationTestCase<T extends Activity>
          Deprecated. new tests should be written using ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2, which provides more options for configuring the Activity under test
 class ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2<T extends Activity>
          This class provides functional testing of a single activity.
 class ActivityUnitTestCase<T extends Activity>
          This class provides isolated testing of a single activity.
 class SingleLaunchActivityTestCase<T extends Activity>
          If you would like to test a single activity with an InstrumentationTestCase, this provides some of the boiler plate to launch and finish the activity in SingleLaunchActivityTestCase.setUp() and SingleLaunchActivityTestCase.tearDown().

Methods in android.test with parameters of type Activity
static void TouchUtils.dragQuarterScreenDown(InstrumentationTestCase test, Activity activity)
          Simulate touching in the center of the screen and dragging one quarter of the way down

          Simulate touching in the center of the screen and dragging one quarter of the way up

          Simulate touching the center of a view and dragging to the bottom of the screen.

          Simulate touching the center of a view and dragging to the bottom of the screen.
static void TouchUtils.scrollToBottom(InstrumentationTestCase test, Activity activity, ViewGroup v)
          Scroll a ViewGroup to the bottom by repeatedly calling TouchUtils.dragQuarterScreenUp(InstrumentationTestCase, Activity)
static void TouchUtils.scrollToTop(InstrumentationTestCase test, Activity activity, ViewGroup v)
          Scroll a ViewGroup to the top by repeatedly calling TouchUtils.dragQuarterScreenDown(InstrumentationTestCase, Activity)
